poem:
Title: "Puppeteer's Requiem"

In old Covent Garden, the tides have turned,
Judy ascends, Punch's script spurned.
Away from the punch line, the wood and string,
Judy rises in the spotlight's ring.
No puppeteer's hand nor old tradition,
Mute her voice, her bold petition.
Tales retold, anew and bright--
The audience watches tonight.
Three centuries past, but Punch's reign is no more.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Judy stands up to Punch as classic puppet show gets modern makeover After 362 years of frankly horrendous treatment at the hands of her husband, Mr Punch, Judy has had enough. For the first time, the female half of the most famous puppet double act in history will take centre stage at a brand-new contemporary version of the seaside favourite, Punch and Judy, at London’s Covent Garden tomorrow.
